viewoption:activateChineseDescription: This enables word lookup for ancient Chinese texts. Word meanings are from the Digital Dictionary of Buddhism.
viewoption:activatePaliDescription: Analyzes the Pali text and attempts to display the word meaning. Note that this is an aid only, and is not always accurate. Word meanings are from the New Concise Pali English Dictionary.
viewoption:changePaliScriptDescription: This enables you to read the Pali text in various scripts.
viewoption:chineseLookupDictionaryDisabl: The 汉语 lookup dictionary is now disabled.
viewoption:displaysInfo: Displays information such as volume/page references, variant readings, etc.
viewoption:lookupDictionaryEnabled: The {lookupDictionary} lookup dictionary is now enabled.
viewoption:noteDescription: Where available, view comments on the translation and variant readings for root texts.
viewoption:noteSummary: Show notes and variants in segmented texts
viewoption:notesDescription: See translator's notes, variant readings, etc..
viewoption:onlyWorks: This only works with certain texts, which include translations by Sujato and Brahmali.
viewoption:paliLookupDictionaryDisabled: The Pali lookup dictionary is now disabled.
viewoption:referenceDescription: “Main” displays the primary SuttaCentral references for segmented texts, and all references for other texts. Remaining items are extra Pali editions.
viewoption:scriptChanged: Pali is now shown in {paliScript} script.
viewoption:showHighlightingDescription: Where applicable, highlight the text to show extra details such as variant readings, corrections, structure, etc.
viewoption:textViewDescription: Some texts on SuttaCentral are “segmented”; the original text and translation are approximately matched line by line. For such texts, see both root text and translation.
viewoption:textViewEnabled: {textView}-view is now enabled on applicable texts.
error:connectToInternet: Please connect to the internet to use search.
footer:editions: SuttaCentral Editions: read selected translations as books
footer:readingfaithfully: ReadingFaithfully—Devotional and contemplative sutta reading for the faithful disciple
footer:scawesome: Awesome SuttaCentral—Awesome stuff built on top of SuttaCentral’s awesomeness

interface:anIntroductionBodhiTitle: A Thematic Guide to the Aṅguttara Nikāya

interface:chooseYourLanguageDescription: Where available, view transactions and site UI in selected language.
interface:discussSuttas: Discuss the suttas on our forum
interface:dnEssayTitle: The Long Discourses: Dhamma as literature and compilation
interface:dnGuideSujatoTitle: The Long Discourses: Dhamma as literature and compilation
interface:generalGuideSujato: A Reader’s Guide to the Pali Suttas
interface:generalGuideSujatoTitle: A Reader’s Guide to the Pali Suttas
interface:joinDiscussion: Join the discussion about this sutta.
interface:metaDescriptionText: Early Buddhist texts and modern translations. Suttas (sutras) from the Tipitaka (Tripitaka) in Pali, Chinese, Sanskrit, and Tibetan with the Buddha's teachings on mindfulness, insight, wisdom, and meditation.
interface:metaKeywords: Buddha, Buddhism, Buddhist, sutta, sutra, tipitaka, tripitaka, wisdom, teaching, mindfulness, meditation, scripture, canon, Pali, Sanskrit, Tibetan, Chinese, insight, vipassana
interface:mnEssayTitle: The Middle Discourses: conversations on matters of deep truth
interface:mnGuideSujatoTitle: The Middle Discourses: conversations on matters of deep truth
interface:pageSubtitle: Early Buddhist texts, translations, and parallels
interface:snEssayTitle: The Linked Discourses: the blueprint for Buddhist philosophy
interface:snGuideSujatoTitle: The Linked Discourses: the blueprint for Buddhist philosophy
interface:vinayaEssayTitle: Monastic Law: how monastic communities should live
offline:additionalInfo: In addition, you can download texts in languages of your choosing and read them when offline. This is especially useful for users on mobiles with limited data, or in regions with poor coverage. If your data is limited, we recommend connecting to wifi before downloading.
offline:certainFunctions: Certain functions, including search, require internet connection.
offline:chineseLookupsDescription: Select to download dictionary lookups of Chinese words in the following languages:
offline:doesntSupportPWAs: Unfortunately we don't support advanced Progressive Web App (PWA) features on your platform. If you want full offline usage, please use an up-to-date version of Chrome. We plan to implement more PWA features on other browsers in the future.
offline:downloadComplete: Your download is complete. You may now read suttas in {lang} offline.
offline:downloadErrored: Your download is complete, But we were not able to download all the requested texts. {failed} out of {total} requests did not complete correctly.
offline:downloadParallelsDescription: Select to download parallel tables for texts as well.
offline:downloadRootTextsDescription: Select to download texts in root languages as well. This includes a Pali > {toLang} lookup dictionary. To change your lookup, click
offline:downloadStarted: Your download has now started. You can keep using the site and we will let you know when it’s complete.
offline:extraFeatures: If you want extra features, let us know.
offline:newTech: PWAs are a new technology. For now, offline usage has some limitations:
offline:paliLookupsDescription: Select to download dictionary lookups of Pali words in the following languages:
offline:pwaDescription: SuttaCentral is a Progressive Web App. On supported devices, many features, including navigation and previously visited pages, will continue to work even if you have no internet connection.
offline:selectDifferentLang: By default your suttas will be downloaded in the site language. If you would like to choose a different language, select one from the menu.
offline:supportsPWAs: Your browser supports Progressive Web Apps!
offline:suttasOnly: Suttas only, not Vinaya or Abhidhamma.
publication:title: Publication details
publication:titleDescription: This text is included in the following publication.
publication:licenseDescription: To the extent possible under law, {authorName} has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to {translationTitle}. This work is published from Australia.
search:hint: Hint: Search e.g. mn34 or sn3.2 to go straight to that sutta.
search:noResult:
There where no results for '{searchTerm}'.
Consider searching on the forum or posting a new question.
suttaplex:alignedDescription: translations are matched segment by segment with the root text. These are produced by SuttaCentral with our Bilara translation application.
suttaplex:alignedOperationGuide: Click through to the translation, then click the “Views” button on the toolbar to see text and translation line-by-line or side-by-side.
suttaplex:annotatedDescription: translations have notes on the text and translation.
suttaplex:annotatedOperationGuide: Click through to the translation, then click the “Views” button on the toolbar to select options for reading notes.
suttaplex:legacyDescription: translations have been adapted for SuttaCentral from various sources. They lack features such as alignment and annotations.
suttaplex:fullParallel: Full parallel: different versions of the same text.
suttaplex:goToTextInOriginalLanguage: Go to text in original language
suttaplex:hasNoParallels: This text has no recorded parallels.
suttaplex:mention: Mention: one text is quoted or mentioned in another.
suttaplex:retellingParallel: Retelling: the events of one text are retold in another.
suttaplex:volumeAndPagePTS1: PTS volume and page: 1st edition = {pts-vp-pli1ed}; 2nd edition = {pts-vp-pli2ed}
text:languagePromptMessage: You can change the language from the menu in the toolbar.
